Ultimate Monster Revealed (definite spolier)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Ultimate Monster Revealed (definite spolier)
By Eagle_Fierce on Sunday, September 10, 2000 - 04:05 am:

I unlocked the Ultimate Monster this morning, since my Dad was on-call, I had to be off-;line, and decided to play. Well, to put it shortly, everyone might as well stop playing, right now.

The Ultimate Monster is the one that has gotten the most questions since the series started. Yes, I am referring to Moo. Moo, the legendary, sub-par, Dragon/??? is the Ultimate Monster. The saddest part of this farce lies not in what the Ultimate Monster was, but what it DID!

Moo has a mere 8 lives, and does nothing more than provide you with the chance to have a second pure-breed (technically) Dragon. The story for the Moo card is totally unimpressive, as well, and there appears to be no purpose to play after obtaining it.

Well, now we all know what the "Ultimate Monster" is. I, for one, am NOT amused, and feel cheated for all the hard work I put into this game.

By torey_luvullo on Sunday, September 10, 2000 - 05:37 am:

thanx eagle. so what you're saying is that the ultimate monster[i'm trying not to mention its name until i'm sure it won't appear in the last day line] doesnt take over the paradise of monsters, or sell alice into slavery, or anything interesting like that - its just moo, hes on a card, and thats that.

anyway, good work, and another good report!
